item.title: Bayes Theorem
item.description: Bayes’ theorem is used to describe the probability of an event. It is defined as: $$ p(y | x) = \frac{p(x|y)p(y)}{p(x)} $$

item.title: Posterior Probability
item.description: Posterior probability is the probability that a given data points belongs to a class. It is often represented by $p(\omega_1|x)$ where $\omega_1$ is a group and $x$ is a data point.
